content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
No new structures have been successfully placed on the map. The agent repeatedly attempted to supply a Lab for Automation Science Pack research at Position(0.5, 2.5) but did not manage to place a Lab due to resource and inventory shortfalls. Pre‐existing production facilities were referenced during recovery:
 
### Iron Smelting Furnace at Position(5.0, 5.0)
Used to smelt iron ore and coal into iron plates needed for downstream crafting. The furnace was retrieved for processing 10 iron ore and 10 coal into additional iron plates.

### Copper Smelting Furnace at Position(–27.0, –60.0)
Used to process harvested copper ore and coal into copper plates, a key component for producing copper cables required in the Lab crafting chain.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Call Parameter Errors
  – Avoid using unexpected keyword arguments. The get_entities call initially used a ‘radius’ keyword and later incorrectly passed multiple positional arguments. Verify the API’s signature and use only supported parameter formats.

• Iteration on Potential None Results
  – Ensure that calls returning collections (such as get_entities) are checked for None before iterating over them to prevent ‘NoneType’ errors.

• Lab Placement and Inventory Issues
  – Before attempting to place a Lab at Position(0.5, 2.5), confirm that a Lab entity is present in the inventory. Handling empty or missing retrieval results can avoid placement failures.

• Crafting Dependency Shortages
  – Lab crafting failures were due to missing sub-ingredients (iron-gear-wheel, electronic-circuit, copper-cable). Verify that production chains (smelting and intermediate crafting) reliably deliver all required components and that resource prerequisites are met before reattempting Lab production.
